citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
According to an IACUC incident report, on September 24, 2023, a laboratory technician for a canine user lab completed
the morning (AM) observations for two study dogs. A laboratory technician did not complete the second observation (PM)
as indicated in the protocol.
During the morning laboratory record review on September 25, 2023, a ULAR veterinarian noted that the AM observation
was completed but the PM observation did not occur. The protocol requires laboratory technicians to complete two
observations (AM and PM) per day of all active study dogs. The Principal Investigator was contacted about the incident
and the two dogs were examined by the ULAR veterinarian.
With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall review and approve,
require modifications (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed significant changes regarding the care and
use of animals in ongoing activities.
Corrected before the time of inspection through corrective action plan and retraining of laboratory staff.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(7) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
According to an IACUC incident report, on September 24, 2023, a laboratory technician for a canine user lab completed 
the morning (AM) observations for two study dogs. A laboratory technician did not complete the second observation (PM) 
as indicated in the protocol.  
 
During the morning laboratory record review on September 25, 2023, a ULAR veterinarian noted that the AM observation 
was completed but the PM observation did not occur. The protocol requires laboratory technicians to complete two 
observations (AM and PM) per day of all active study dogs. The Principal Investigator was contacted about the incident 
and the two dogs were examined by the ULAR veterinarian.  
 
With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall review and approve, 
require modifications (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed significant changes regarding the care and 
use of animals in ongoing activities.  
 
Corrected before the time of inspection through corrective action plan and retraining of laboratory staff. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
